level.text: In addition to the general functions specified in ยง 5700, a nurse-anesthetist may perform all of the functions listed below, to include:
Determining the health status of the patient as it relates to the relative risks associated with the anesthetic management of the patient;
Based on history, physical assessment, and supplemental laboratory results, determining appropriate type of anesthesia;

Performing procedures commonly used to render the patient insensible to pain during the performance of surgical, obstetrical, therapeutic, or diagnostic clinical procedures. This shall include ordering and administering:
Order or perform monitoring procedures indicated as pertinent to the anesthetic health care management of the patient;

Support life functions during anesthesia health care, including inductions and intubation procedures, the use of appropriate mechanical supportive devices, and the management of fluid, electrolyte, and blood component balances;
Recognize and take appropriate corrective action for abnormal patient responses to anesthesia, adjunctive medication, or other forms of therapy;
Recognize and treat cardiac arrhythmia while the patient is under anesthetic care;

Management of the patient while in the post-anesthesia recovery phase, including post-anesthesia evaluation of the patient, ordering the administration of fluids and drugs, discharging of the patient;
Place peripheral and central venous and arterial lines for blood sampling and monitoring as appropriate; and

Such other functions and services the Board deems appropriate upon review and analysis of professional and association literature which articulates scopes and standards for nurse-anesthetist practice.
